website_summaries.verdict: This highly-rated dog harness provides the utmost support and comfort for dogs of all sizes.
pros: Available to purchase for dogs of various sizes and genders
Able to attach to dog leash and collar for supreme control
Padded twice to prevent fabric from bunching and to provide ultimate comfort
cons: Customers wish this product had a back strap to stop the support pad from slipping

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!!!  More than pleased!!!
customer_reviews.text: This harness has been a Godsend! I have a 13 1/2 year old GSD with degenerative issues in his spine. At times he is weak in the back end and at times he is very awkward and wobbly and will occasionally fall. This helps him walk much better with my assistance so he doesn't fall. I would recommend this product to anyone. It is really well made and well desinged, nice and padded, and designed perfectly for the male dog so he doesn't pee on it while wearing it. Definitely worth the money. The greatest feature though is the leash part that I connect to his collar so the harness doesn't slide backwards on him while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for paraplegic dog
customer_reviews.text: My doxie girl has been down for a week from grade 4 IVDD. I've been really breaking my own back with slings I've made with things from around the house, they weren't the best solution. It's hard to keep a scarf wrapped around her as I carry her out to her potty spot. The gingerlead has been amazing. I can clip it on her while she is still in her pen, lift her up and it still stays securely around her. It's made potty breaks much easier. She's already started trying to move her legs since we have begun using it. It's a great help to keep her wobbly paralyzed back half, from going anywhere her front half isn't going.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Big help for a big dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our 90 lb dog had knee surgery on both legs at the same time. This worked great for me. I like the hook to his collar, as it made getting him to stand easier. I would slip it under him as he laid down, then get him all hooked up and then up to stand. I had a easier time of him not going down our ramp too fast by having the collar hooked. I did get everything adjusted before the surgery, that was a big help.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Peacock

customer_reviews.title: No longer on his last legs!
customer_reviews.text: This has given a big old golden retriever new life! It has made it so much easier for him to go up/down stairs--necessary in our home in order for him to go outside. With an increase in accidents because he didn't want to tackle the stairs even once a day, we were beginning the debate about his quality of life and how much longer we thought he had. But, the extra security of being in the Gingerlead on the stairs has not only reduced his fear of falling and increased his willingness to go out more often, but he has gone from being tired and depressed to being much happier and more energetic.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hibbard

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful! We were desperate for help lifting our crippled ...
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! We were desperate for help lifting our crippled 14 year old female lab everywhere! It is the only way she is alive and living well with us. We are grateful for this carefully-engineered, well-made 'lifter', and for the great reviews. Thanks to the confidence of previous purchasers, we bought and could not be more grateful! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Great help
customer_reviews.text: It is helpful, but it is a but of trouble getting it on in time to get him outside fast enough. But it is certainly helpful for our 15 year old Siberian Husky who still loves life, just has a problem getting up from a sitting or laying position. Once he is uo and acclimated he even runs! He is our love for sure...we want to keep him as comfortable as we can until he just isn't able any longer. That will be a hard day. I recommend this to anyone who has a dog who is still happy and able.
customer_reviews.author: gracie

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea and better than a towel
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea and better than a towel, but doesn't work well for my male dog. It constantly has to be adjusted in order for him to be able to urinate without peeing on the harness. If its moved forward to allow him to urinate, then its not supporting his back end which defeats the purpose of the harness. This harness would probably be OK for a female dog. We ended up buying a HelpEm Up Harness which is more expensive, but works extremely well and is worth the extra money. My male dog can go to the bathroom very easily now.
customer_reviews.author: Woodbridge Properties

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! My 110 lb., 12 year old GSD has arthritis in her back, and has difficulty getting up and sometimes walking. This is just what we needed. We are able to assist her to stand and walk as needed. It doesn’t seem to bother her. She quickly came to understand that we were helping her get around! I am short, so the hand grip is perfect height for me to walk beside her. It does not get in the way of her elimination. The Ginger Lead, along with prescribed meds will give us more time together!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Queequeg the elderly pug says "Arf Arf" (translation:  Thank You Very Much!!!!)
customer_reviews.text: My 14 y/o rescue pug loves his walks again (and his Mom isn't frustrated by his just giving up and sitting down in the middle of the lawn just to have him leave a Mr. Hinky in the kitchen hours later). Thanks from Queequeg, the 2016 Candidate for President of the US from the Pupparoni Party.
customer_reviews.author: anotherVulcan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for Louie the Sheltie
customer_reviews.text: My shetland sheepdog had degenerative myelopathy which is a progressive disease of the spinal cord. His rear legs were the first things to stop functioning, so we bought this lead. It was perfect because I had to walk him in the yard several times a day so that he could use the bathroom. Before we purchased it, I had been holding up his bottom and back legs while he walked around the yard, which was really hard on my back. This was also great because we were able to help him exercise his front legs.
customer_reviews.author: Khaki

customer_reviews.title: Supports both front and back legs. Awesome support!
customer_reviews.text: My Roo was born with two front deformed legs which one was amputated leaving him with just a front nub. Last week he had Luxating Patella surgery on his left hind leg leaving him with only one working back leg. I searched everywhere and this is the sling I picked! Iam so happy how well it works for us! I can lift him up off the floor no problem and support him both on his front and back legs. This sling was a lifesaver. It is so well made padded and has sturdy straps. I would definitely recommend this sling it’s the best. Thank you so much Gingerlead (:
customer_reviews.author: Roo Roo ❤️❤️❤️

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Our French Bulldog recently lost function in her rear legs and we wanted something to help suspend her so we could work her legs to prevent atrophy. The product is excellent quality and the material is durable. Our Frenchie is a bit of a hard fit and the support pours a lot of pressure on her bladder (which she can't control) so it's not the greatest fit, but I think that's because of her breed and not the quality of the product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. I ordered size med/large (based on measurements)for my 55lb boxer who has rapidly progressing weakness of her back legs. A small would have fit a little better. I would have realized if I had read more carefully that you may need to size down for barrel chested dogs such as boxers. The stay on straps were left out, but an email to the company led to a rapid response and delivery of the stay on attachment straps (which are actually just turned out to be Velcro strips similar to the ones sold for cable management).
customer_reviews.author: SHM

customer_reviews.title: We love the Ginger Lead
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased a sling for our older dog to help support the weight on her back legs. The sling always collapsed into a narrow band that made it uncomfortable for her around her abdomen. Because it also didn't support her on both sides it was difficult for her to walk in a straight line. When we got the Ginger lead, it was a totally different experience for her. It's comfortable, it supports her on both sides and it gives us the ability to help her control the direction she wants to go in. We are so grateful for this harness!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Davis

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly helpful product for dog’s rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: I am so grateful for this product. My 6 lb. Yorkie recently suffered a stroke. Her stability is off, particularly with her hind legs, and it’s been difficult managing her safely during our very brief walks. The lead arrived four days ahead of schedule—thank you for the prompt shipping! From our first use, the support of the lead has given her stability and confidence. The handle is so easy to use. I can easily give her support as needed and prevent her from stumbling. She is now happily moving along without worry. This is going to be a perfect aid as she continues to regain her motor skills. Thank you for designing such an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Fionnuala Sausalito

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: This sling is making things so much easier for Rowdy. She dislocated her hip and is still bandaged up. My vet loaned me a ridiculous sling that bunched up and it really bothered the dog. Using a rolled up towel wasn't much better. They both made trying to walk her a real trial and I was bitten many times. This sling is easy to get her into. It doesn't bunch up and has great padding. The Velcro attachment to keep it on could use some refining. I'm sure I can come up with something. I also bought a harness and attach the sling to it. The two together are really helping to make walking easier on both of us.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Raffy can go for walks again!
customer_reviews.text: This product enables my dog who suffers from a degenerated disc and right sided weakness to once again walk around the block. I bought the mini for my papillon mix 12-14 year old who is unable to maintain his balance while walking. The harness provides enough support so that he can stay standing. I have had to provide a strap connecting his regular halter to the rear harness so that the rear harness doesn't slide back. I would definitely recommend this product for a dog with mobility issues. It really restores Raffy's quality of life to be out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Fortuna

customer_reviews.title: Very much worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my friend’s elderly German shepherd who’s back legs are unsteady. The thick padding is excellent & it came with velcro straps to keep the handles in place so you don’t have to keep ahold of them constantly. I’m going to sew them around one strap in a loop that can go up & down to the desired position so they dont get lost & facilitate easy on & off. This sling was more expensive than others on Amazon but well worth it for quality & comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought the small size for my 5yo Frenchie who ruptured a disk in her back and we'll be using this for long-term rehab. Once you get the length sorted out, it's really great to have one handle to control the front end and the back end at the same time :D She loves to chase things, which she absolutely can't do now, and this allows me to check that impulse while helping her walk about under her own power to exercise her weak back legs. It's narrow enough front to back to not interfere w/ pee/poop, and because it's just a sling, doesn't wrap all the way around, it's not hot.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for dog with IVDD back issues
customer_reviews.text: My 31 lb beagle had back surgery. This sling helps me to support her paralyzed back legs while taking her outside for potty breaks. The velcro strap that cushions the handle is kind of backward, so it's awkward to put it together, and my arthritic hands hurt when holding her up with this sling. Other than that, the padded belly area is great for her, and the sling is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Helped our dog
customer_reviews.text: Our elder dog has limited use of his hind legs, which causes him hot to be able to walk for more than several feet. More of an issue is he has problems relieving himself, not always able to stand to urinate, or falling backward when defecating. The gingerlead support harness has really helped him. It is easy to get him in/out of the harness in 10-15 seconds and he enjoys walking around like he used to (with our support) while he investigates the yard to do his business. Thanks Gingerlead!
customer_reviews.author: J. Asik

customer_reviews.title: great harness
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on other's reviews. Great help in getting my Great Dane up off the floor when he falls. It's gentle with the padding, and it allows him to go to the bathroom without taking it off. He has degenerative mylopathy and will need help walking at some point. This allows you to help them up, walk them with all the dignity required. Easy to put on even when he's laying on the floor. I recommend this to anyone whose baby needs help getting up and or walking
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable, easy to use, worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, have been using a size large for my 65lb dog who has two injured ACLs. She's also only 3 months post op from bladder surgery, meaning I needed to provide support to her back legs while being sensitive to her bladder/belly area. The Gingerlead feels comfortable and sturdy, providing both me and my dog confidence while trying to walk. Just a few tries to figure out the perfect strap adjustment for us, but once we did, it's really been a life saving product that is completely worth the cost. Highly recommend to any pet owner needing to provide gentle yet sturdy back leg assistance for your pup.
customer_reviews.author: Lynann Barr

customer_reviews.title: Helping my dog walk after tearing two ACLs // pre-surgery
customer_reviews.text: After my dog tore both of her ACLs, she was unable to use her back two legs to walk or go outside to use potty. Using a towel was our immediate solve but was very difficult to use and walk with her. The GingerLead is sturdy, comfortable, and allows me to provide a good amount of support for my dog with ease. She got the hang of using the GingerLead rather easily and I like the collar attachment for enhanced control and stability of the sling. My dog is getting surgery next week and plan to use this post-surgery as she recovers.
customer_reviews.author: Maranda McGeary

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for us
customer_reviews.text: When we first bought this, I didn't know there were any other kinds of harnesses. I can't use it anymore. His back legs are no longer working due to DM. When he goes pee, he gets pee all over it. The handles are way too long. I shortened them but the weight distribution is off. We bought a walking dog harness and it is much easier to use. And you can leave it in all day. With that said, it is one of the better harnesses out there in this style. It will not bunch up or lose its shape. I just cant use it. It is a quality product if you like this style.
customer_reviews.author: Saltwater🏝Soul

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this a thousand times over
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this a thousand times over! After an unexplainable injury that left my dog unable to walk and dragging himself around with his front paws, multiple vets told me that he may never be able to walk again and couldn't explain why. I refused to give up and ordered this with highest of hopes. After a couple months of using this harness for multiple walks a day, and some chiropractic adjustments, my baby was able to not only walk again but run again too. He has since passed but my heart is happy knowing that he was able to live out his last days the way he deserved to, like a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest ever for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: This slingg is the best ever. Even my veterinary neurologist was impressed with it and told me he’d never seen one like it before. The one improvement I would like to suggest is an additional attachment to keep the sling front slipping back under male dogs so they don’t pee on it. I have a 9 lb Chihuahua. It’s easy enough to clean though. I ended up buying an extra small dog collar with a snap in closure and put it through the ring of his harness and the ring in the sling and it worked beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Krau

customer_reviews.title: On behalf of our family Great Dane Sasha. we give this Ginger Lead thanks
customer_reviews.text: We purchased all female great dane one ... on behalf of our 11 yr of age family Great Dave Sasha this Ginger Lead has been assisting her through a medical condition ... my husband had told me about this product.., I found it on Amazon and sure am so very happy we found.. on her recent veterinarian recheck she remarked on the Ginger Lead that its a fine product.,., Sasha thinks so too... Thank you from Joseph and Kathy of course Sasha of Vacaville California
customer_reviews.author: Caninekathy🐕

customer_reviews.title: Helping our pug who just had neck surgery
customer_reviews.text: We have a small, old pug who recently had a ventral slot procedure at C2-C3 without any complications. He needs support when he walks outside, and the GingerLead (size small) is helping him. We can't use it with a harness yet because his neck is still healing, so to prevent the GingerLead from slipping down his chest to his belly and covering his penis when he urinates, we twist the cords under the handle around a couple of times when he's wearing it. Since his body is so short compared to the dogs in the pictures, I'm not sure if the GingerLead will work like it does on them. But it is helping.
customer_reviews.author: Feanor

customer_reviews.title: Get this for your walking-impaired pet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for our little dog who had major back surgery. It is much better than the cloth one they sent home from the vet office. This one holds her hind quarters securely, it allows her to try to walk and strengthen her legs, it allows her to go to the bathroom and it is comfortable. I am so glad I decided to get it, it has saved out lives. Please get this for your animal, you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Red Head 918

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use pet support
customer_reviews.text: We were so please first because it came so quickly and second because it was so easy to use and our dog Walker adjusted to it so well. It is never easy when your furry family member is struggling and this product made all the difference! I’m happy to say our 12 year old golden retriever is on the mend and only needs assistance on the stairs at night as he insists on sleeping in our room! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: L. Michele Stutzer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Buddie our Lab almost 17 and just installed new vinyl floors and very slippery. Having really difficult time, constantly falling and can not get back up, his back legs just aren’t strong enough. Considered several choices and ideas and chose this one. Believe me it works. Took some time and practice and can now walk pretty ok using straps assistance. I scrapped the keep it on feature as very easy to slip on when needed. We use his existing harness in conjunction from time to time but does well without now that he’s used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jt

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Works well, is very durable and comfortable. I have a 70lb boxer that had ACL surgery and he can’t do steps for 8 weeks and back can’t handle carrying him up and down our steps to go out to the bathroom. We used it prior to the surgery to get our dog use to it with treats for getting it on, off and walking it in and I would suggest doing this. I’d purchase it again, it won’t disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Makes life much easier
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 pound miniature dachshund who just had spinal surgery for ruptured discs. At first I was leading her around with her leash in one hand and a sling for her back/back legs in the other. The Gingerlead makes getting her outside and walking so much easier on me. The mini/xsmall fits her perfectly and I love that every part of the lead is adjustable to help you customize it even more to your dog and to your own height. I’m able to slide the hand grip to be able to adjust where I provide the most support for her. She shows no signs of being uncomfortable while walking with this on. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Helped a short girl walk her older big dog
customer_reviews.text: My older 106 lbs GSD took suddenly ill and almost overnight couldn’t use her back legs. I ordered the Gingerlead support and immediately it helped me (I’m 5 ft tall) to help my big girl walk around. I found it simple to put on her and easy to use. She actually perked up when she saw me grab it. Unfortunately she we had to let her go recently, but at least I know on her most difficult days, this support helped her move around and feel like big dog she was
customer_reviews.author: Marie F

customer_reviews.title: FITS ALL
customer_reviews.text: This harness’ basic form and function provides incredible support. The use of a towel can provide support and is perfect for immediate use. However it begins to take it’s toll on caregivers after even one day. The harness requires very little effort from me. I know that eliminating any strain big or small while caring for loved ones can make a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect! Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small for my petite 45 lbs 10 year old boxer with DM. It fits perfect. Now I can get her up and down the stairs to go outside. My dog got the concept in moments.
customer_reviews.author: julie michels

customer_reviews.title: This sling has more than paid for itself
customer_reviews.text: We have used the Gingerlead for our dog who has degenerative myelopathy (DM) for several years now. At first we used it to actually take her for walks around our area when she could partially use her back legs and to get her up and down stairs. Now we use it to get her up the stairs every day and for short walks. The quality is very high and we have never worried about it tearing or coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but needs a design update....
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is just Ok. All the ones I looked at are made the same way. It's nice that it has a cutout for the male dog so he can urinate (which others didn't have), but the design is flawed. There needs to be a velcro strap or a strap with a buckle over the dogs back to help keep this on and in place. If you let go of the handles if falls down and then the dog is tripping all over it trying to get it off. I will have to see if I can rig up something to hold this on my dog.
customer_reviews.author: LJR

customer_reviews.title: Not for dags with severely limited rear leg function
customer_reviews.text: I have a 80 pound black lab that had pretty much lost the use of his rear legs, I bought this in hope that I could help support him when he used the bathroom, but this slides way to much and he ended up peeing on it more then not, it would also slide forward and end up supporting his chest and not his rear end which would cause him to not be able to stand, I tried adjusting it with the included velcro straps as much as possible but it could never get tight enough
customer_reviews.author: jeff tucker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Sling for Great Dane post TPLO Surgery!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME! My 8yr old Great Dane recently had TPLO Surgery. The orthopedic surgeon sent her home with a crappy sling that was binding and not very padded. This sling was PERFECT. I loved the handle, the padding, and especially the integrated lead to hook to her collar. This allowed me to not only help her up, but hold her back when she wanted to do more than was advised. Important to note for post TPLO, let your dog do the walking. I made the mistake of trying to help too much and that complicates the three legged walk. When I eased off and let her do it...the sling did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: S. Riedel

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect size for her (her midsection is pretty thin nowadays) ...
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this for my elderly shih tzu. She weighs about 9 lbs ( and is 16 yrs old). This is the perfect size for her (her midsection is pretty thin nowadays) and there's a good amount of adjustability in the harness too. Her hips are very weak and she often stumbles, making walking very difficult. This support along with a puppia brand small harness seems to be a perfect combination. I don't tighten either too much, so it's still very comfortable for her, but having both support points and holding the 'leash' portion of this harness straight up to stabilize my dog seems to be working really well.
customer_reviews.author: MMN

customer_reviews.title: A Winner
customer_reviews.text: My 30 pound boy was unable to stand on his own. This leash was perfect for helping him to walk and maintain his posture to go potty without me having to bend over to hold him up. Although he sometimes spilled on it as the leash fit in front of his penis, the leash washes very well in the machine so it was very easy to clean. It did not slide around his belly even when he was walking, which was very helpful in keeping him upright. It allowed me to help him walk and get some exercise without killing my back.
customer_reviews.author: Pepperpot

customer_reviews.title: this was the next best purchase to try
customer_reviews.text: This has a been a real asset for my friend who was in need of assistance for their elderly dog who lives on a second floor. It was real heart-breaking to see her struggle up and down stairs. With the owner unable to move from their current living location, this was the next best purchase to try. I'm so very thankful it was available and I can't say enough on it's quality and durability. If anyone has an older dog or a dog that struggles with stairs, this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel8113

customer_reviews.title: Delivers as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The thing you have to remember is all dogs are different. After her TPLO surgery, my dog hated having her back legs lifted to assist her movements on stairs. But it was all new to her- so she gets a pass. This device did everything it was supposed to do to help me help her recover faster.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna P

customer_reviews.title: In concert with a chest harness, this is a life-extender for an old dog
customer_reviews.text: My 85 lb, 14-year old dog can no longer get around on her own. With the Ginger Lead and a chest harness (the Ginger Lead works with the harness), I can help her stand, walk, and defecate relatively comfortably - for both of us. I am very happy with the product and would recommend it for anybody with a partially mobile dog.
customer_reviews.author: Oakland Mike

customer_reviews.title: Canine sling, but really it's a human back saver!!
customer_reviews.text: My 10-yr old boxer mix has degenerative myopathy and her back legs are losing some strength. This sling is perfect for her. It allows me to help stabilize her while she goes to bathroom and no more stooping over to hold her. It also has given her stability while walking. She practically runs now for daily walks! I haven't seen her move that fast in 6 months! Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen H

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: not sure about the clip leash to the collar part but i took that off and its highly useful in keeping my husky mix elevated off his back end when he constantly wants to sit down when i have to attend to a surgery site. really could have used this a few years ago too when another husky slipped a disk and my husband had to slowly walk her a little further each day for a very long time. particularly helpful for male dogs due to the cut.
customer_reviews.author: cillbat

customer_reviews.title: We can BOTH walk more easily now!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" tall with a 16 lb pekingese who has IVDD and still has some paralysis in one of her back legs after spine surgery. (Her back end sways.) I have tried using a harness with a leash along with the along the hospital gave us...but I was always hunched over and would have to use both hands. NOT ANY MORE!! This ginger lead has a nice LONG joined handle for the leash and the sling. She is a much more confident and happy dog with it, and I don't get my own back ache from walking her. Definitely worth EVERY PENNY!!
customer_reviews.author: 3 Dog Mama

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for a sling for my 12 lb dog who has a rear leg injury, but the ones I found were too large - he urinated on the part that went under his belly. This product works great! I like how I can clip it to his harness as well and the "handle" is long enough that it doesn't kill my back (having to bend over). I showed it to my vet so she could recommend it to other small dog owners.
customer_reviews.author: KatieC

customer_reviews.title: Helps with my Rottie
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this for my 135 pound Rottie who can no longer use her back legs. I just recently got it but so far it is holding up great. My dog seems comfortable in it. It has helped me so much. Her other harness was a nightmare getting on her.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca P

customer_reviews.title: would definitely recommend this lift
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we only had 1 &1/2 days to use it. Because of it my husband was able to help our Greyhound go outside to go potty. However, we received it on Thursday and on Saturday morning our Greyhound Crossed The Rainbow Bridge. We gave the lift to our Vet to be used for patients after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Divine

customer_reviews.title: Gingerlead
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased to receive the the gingerlead. Grace my large Lab is having problems with her hips. Two weeks ago she and my beagle Sam chased down a rabbit in their yard. Grace got completely down for several days.Fortunately she is able now to go out on her own.I ordered the gingerlead to have if she needs it. Right now she is ok without it. She smelled it and wagged her tail when I introduced it.I think this will work when we need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lead, does exactly what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Great product!!! It helping our foster dachshund walk and not hurt our backs as were leaning over. Between the lead, his vets and massage therapist he is walking again. The lead gives him just enough support that he doesn't fall over as he is still wobbly. Can't say enough wonderful things about this lead. Works great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: This harness is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using the Gingerlead Dog Support & Rehab Harness to help my 12 yr old Whippet with her mobility after a very difficult surgery that involved the amputation of her front right leg.....it has been a serious adjustment for her physically,but,the Gingerlead has been a Godsend in helping her with her balance during her rehabilitation...I can't thank Gingerlead ENOUGH for creating this much needed product...If you are looking for a wonderfully constructed & comfortable harness for your fur baby...THIS IS IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCR711

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After our Doodle blew her ACL and while we were waiting for surgery, I spent hours...looking, researching, re-looking and comparing harnesses. This was by far just what I was looking for. While some might think they are a little pricey, let me remind you...you get what you pay for! A very well made product! Both our “regular” vet and at the “speciality” veterinarian hospital that we had to go out of town for, were quite impressed! Said they had never seen anything like it. And it’s made in the USA 🇺🇸!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver for my 12 1/2 year old collie
customer_reviews.text: The quality materials and workmanship is evident and my dog accepted it on her in the house to get her accustomed to it. I have yet to actually walk her with it, but she is well behaved on the leash. I have no steps except one on the front porch.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic User

customer_reviews.title: Must Have with Large Dogs; Wish I'd Ordered One Sooner
customer_reviews.text: Our 2-year-old Newfoundland ruptured one of her cruciate ligaments two weeks ago. How I wish we had had this sling then; trying to carry her to the vet using a blanket for a sling was extremely difficult. We had been looking at the Ginger Sling for some time, as it comes recommended by both local vets we use, but ordered one to facilitate our dog's recovery from surgery. It works very well, allowing us to support her appropriately as she heals. Thank you for developing this wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: NV Newf Lover

customer_reviews.title: Bilateral luxating pattellas surgery and torn acl
customer_reviews.text: This rehabilitation padded sling and stuff was a life saver. I bought more than one. Hands down Ginger Lead wins. Thank you Gingerlead made life so much easier. I I have a 90 lb pitbull get the unisex one the boys can pee easy.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: but overall I think this a great, nicely padded
customer_reviews.text: My 75 lb lab mix slipped a vert in his back and temporarily lost the use of one of his hind legs. I live in an upstairs condo with ladder type stairs (Very steep, with gaps between steps) I'm 5'2 and 120 lbs and could not safely carry my dog down our stairs. This harness was a lifesaver. I could slowly walk my dog downstairs and support him up while walking him outside. The only problem I have is that he would accidentally pee on it. I'm not sure how it could be designed to avoid that problem, but overall I think this a great, nicely padded, comfortable and well made harness.
customer_reviews.author: Lissy

customer_reviews.title: This support is perfect for 1 or 2 people to handle even a big dog.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had CCL surgery on both legs at the same time. We used this support tool to allow her to go outside in a wagon and then "walk" to a spot to use the bathroom. It is working perfectly to allow her to get the outside time she needs without putting her full weight on her back legs.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Help assist your dog when back legs are failing.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and adjust for a great fit. Comfortable handle and our dog seems very comfortable in it. Great product. Highly recommended. Our dog is losing mobility and strength in her hind legs. With this dog support sling we help her get around especially on her daily walks around the neighborhood. This product is a life saver.♥️😊
customer_reviews.author: Gramma Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great support, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Gingerlead has been a life-saver of my 12 year old chow chow that I rescued as a geriactric senior. It is much easier to put on than other support harnesses and very comfortable for my dog to wear for long periods of time. Easy for her to use the bathroom while wearing. Highly recommend for any dog with limited mobility.
customer_reviews.author: pey

customer_reviews.title: It will work well when we need it.
customer_reviews.text: We are relieved that we bought this and ended up not needing it!! We decided to keep it though because we know that we will need it in the near future for our aging giant dog. So, I can't give an adequate review except to say that it is exactly what we were looking for. It is well made with quality parts and pieces. The reason we went with this particular support harness is that it's made in the USA!! Once we actually use it, I will return and provide a proper review. 4 stars​ because we haven't needed to test it out and use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lei Lu

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My veterinarian recommended this lead as my dog has problems with his hind legs and they will often give out after a short walk. He weighs 65# so my picking him up is not an option. If I hold the Ginger Lead taut against his body as shown in the picture, it causes strain on my shoulder, upper arm, and lower back. If I allow it to go slack until he needs help, he can (and usually does) urinate in it. I have to wash it nearly every time I use it. I tried tying the two sides together to snug it up but it slips back and he will urinate in it.
customer_reviews.author: Island Girl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for dog waiting for 2nd knee surgery.
customer_reviews.text: We liked the sturdiness of this product. It fits our lab mix well. He is recovering from TPL surgery. Unfortunately 4 weeks after the surgery he tore his other knee. So we needed something that could support him while being able to strengthen the first leg until he gets his next surgery. He loves it and took to it right away. Nice product, well made and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful helping hand for my golden.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product for the comfort it gives my golden retriever. The only problem I am having is with the velcro strips that are use to keep the handles together. I don't feel they are long enough or strong enough to keep it together. I wish there was another of keeping it together in that area. I gave up on the strips and I am using clips.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. My 7 month old puppy just had hip dysplasia surgery and is currently in recovery. I've tried multiple slings and harnesses to find what works best for letting him out. We've settled on the Gingerlead. This product is really different because of the attached leash. Easy on and off. The main thing is: size matters. Jasper is a 50-pound dog and on the large end for a border collie. He's slender and muscular but tall. I ordered the medium/large first and it just was way too big. Ended up going with the small and it's a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great for walks! Beware when your male dog has to urinate.
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped my 75-lb, 8-yo Shepherd (Astro) get up and use the bathroom. He's older and has hip dysphasia and his right leg is not strong enough to hold his weight. I usually have to lift him up so he can get a grip but this support helps him up much easier. Although the product has a triangular cut-out to fit male dogs, Astro has wet himself because he wasn't completely clear of the padding. It's useful for longer walks but when he just needs to go out for a quick break, I usually forego using it because it's tricky to get the support out of the way for him to urinate quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TKG

customer_reviews.title: Help maybe a GingerLead away.
customer_reviews.text: My little Chaucy just had emergency spine surgery two weeks ago. His back legs aren’t working yet so have been using a cloth sling from the hospital to help him potty. It is very hard for me because of having to lean over. I ordered the gingerlead and just received. I must purchase the harness so have not had chance to use as yet. But looks to be the answer to my problems. It is made very well and I can almost feel the love and care from which it originated.
customer_reviews.author: Suz D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - has improved my dog's quality of life tremendously
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 6 months ago for my 12-year old, hound-shepherd mix who has Canine degenerative myelopathy. It works exactly as described, and has allowed him to continue to go on short walks (it does get tiring to support him, but we've managed), sniff around the neighborhood, and move easily around our house with us. As his back leg function has deteriorated, it allows us to give him support while he eats and drinks. It has certainly improved his quality of life, and very likely extended his life. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Guian

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to help my 86lb German Shepherd on ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help my 86lb German Shepherd on walks because she was suffering from a muscular disease. The harness was definitely made well the problem my wife and I were having was that the handle was too long and it put our shoulder in an awkward position since our dog was so tall. The manufacture needs to make the handle more adjustable for taller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Darren LaRocque

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver for my elderly German Shepherd. Coupled with a proper front harness, it works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to use for male dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my male beagle. Even though I measured and tested a towel as was suggested, he couldn't urinate with it on, as it covered his privates. When I positioned it in front of his penis, it slipped back. Perhaps the mini GingerLead would have worked better. But we found that a rolled up beach towel worked fine. I returned the item with no trouble, so I do appreciate that.
customer_reviews.author: One Woman's Voice

customer_reviews.title: San Francisco Dachshund says Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: This gentle lead mini harness has been a miracle for us! My 7 year old male dachshund had his second surgery on his back. The recovery this time around has made the daily walks to eliminate and stretch very hard. My back was killing me trying to pick him up and support him. The lead supports him, is fully adjustable, easy for me to walk him and feels sturdy. In a perfect world I won't need to use this to walk him but this is the next best thing. The photo was my attempt to make a harness out of newspaper bags. What a disaster. So happy with our new harness- Willis deserves the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This has done it wonders for my 2.5 year old Chihuahua Dachshund mix which recently lost mobility in her back legs due to IVDD. This has saved my back with taking her to the bathroom and has provided her with some freedom to walk the yard and the house. Using this and crate rest, in just a week my sweet girl has about 80% mobility back! We will continue to use this and highly recommend to anyone who has a dog with a back leg mobility issue.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Helps my senior coonhound walk
customer_reviews.text: My senior Treeing Walker Coonhound likes to walk the length of my 200 foot driveway, but because of his rear legs atrophied muscles and arthritis can be very difficult for him to walk back if he tires at the distant end. At 70 pounds he is too heavy to carry back. The GingerLead is a perfect solution since I can carry it with me and only takes a few seconds to put it on him if needed for the walk back to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Robert Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well to carry my 18 lbs dog up and down stairs several times a day. She's old and has limited strength, so when I injured my back, this harness was a godsend to keep us both safe and healthy. The inner lining is soft against her skin while the exterior cover is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Our Corgi has DM, and we use the GingerLead to help him walk. Keeping a DM dog as active as possible is vital in slowing the progression, and this product enables us to do that. It is sturdy but comfy, and washes well. Only issue is that despite the cut out, when he urinates, it gets on the cushion. But it is easily washed and dried. Great product, and works better for this issue than the ones that go around the back legs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Practice Helps
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very good and it is study. I used it after my 70lb Golden Retriever had ACL surgery. Fit perfectly as pictured in product description. The first few times we used it she was kind of confused as I was pretty much lifting her rear off the ground, but after some practice with it we both got better. Definitely great to have when she was getting up as I could slide it under her and lift her rear as she got up. Made post surgery life a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: SAW88

customer_reviews.title: Durable and helpful
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the lifting sling for about 6 months now. It is durable and shows very little signs of wear. Our 78 lb boxer can no longer stand or walk with out assistance. This sling is a great help when moving her. We purchased the medium male/female sling. It would be nice if the handle straps were a bit shorter. Even with the straps at the shortest adjustment, they are a little too long. We have to do bicep curls to keep her feet from dragging. On the plus side, we're getting great muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McManus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Back saver for you and great support for your pup.
customer_reviews.text: this product is amazing. our little mini dachshund hemorrhage t9-12 on new years day. we opted for surgery. the towels under the back legs worked. however, it was uncomfortable and cumbersome. the gingerlead arrived and we have loved it since day one. buy it, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: JazzerciseMama

customer_reviews.title: Back saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother and his dog walk, he said it works great and it’s totally saved his back. We have about a 24 pound Pekingese and the size small fits great
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver for my dog's hind mobility issues. However, I have lost the small velcro straps to aid in staying on dog unattended. I wish those were attached (somehow). I could have pinned them on if I had realized how often I would be grabbing the harness on short notice to help my senior dog up and down stairs leading outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui Asbury

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars ⭐️
customer_reviews.text: The harness is well made. It is easy to use if you are not strapping it on. I find it a bit difficult to get my golden retriever strapped in. Once on, it doesn’t seem to bother her. It definitely makes it easier to help her walk. I think one should note, if your dog needs more support to the back legs, it might not be for you. The harness lifts the stomach area, not the rear so much. I really need my dog’s back legs supported the most. Hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 👍👎

customer_reviews.title: Great for controlling healing dog
customer_reviews.text: Our mini-Aussie had knee surgery and is feeling better but his healing takes time. The Ginger Lead helps tremendously by not only helping to keep weight off the repaired leg but also by controlling his head to keep him from pulling against the harness with his abdomen. Much easier to use than a towel or pillowcase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When you don't need a full sling, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Made a big difference in my ability to lift and hold up my Irish wolfhound's hind end when his harness caused chafing. The only problem I had with it was that when I held him up, the grip of the sling caused the front and back of the sling to lean upwards. Hard to describe, but between his height and my lack of it, the sling wasn't quite as rigid as I'd hoped. But it was certainly supportive, and the problem was negligible.
customer_reviews.author: LYNNE MASTERS

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing! My 14 year old Lab has back end ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! My 14 year old Lab has back end weakness and some days can barely get up even with help. I had a sling that would bunch up and slide, really useless in this situation, but THIS one is great! I was hoping that the clip on was adjustable like the handles and it is, making it possible to attach this to her harness, creating a full-body support. Very well padded, would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Scire

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: After our pup was hit by a car, we purchased this to help with rehabilitation of her pelvis. It has worked very well and is perfect for it's intent. It makes helping her get around significantly easier than the suggested towel around the belly.
customer_reviews.author: Ldouglas956

customer_reviews.title: Worth a first time review!
customer_reviews.text: I just adopted a dog with some back leg problems. We aren’t sure if it’s neurological or something to do with his spine/hips. I was so worried about walking him around because he would often fall and drag his legs. Sometimes he would come back a little bloodied. Since we got the Gingerlead last week, his walking has improved immensely. Even to the point that it seems to have helped him figure out how to walk with a regular leash. I love this product so much that this is my first review ever.
customer_reviews.author: aykhan629

customer_reviews.title: Great for senior chihuahua with hip dysplasia
customer_reviews.text: This really helps my 16 year old chihuahua with hip dysplasia get around and go for walks! He’s gotten much more confident with moving around and loves strutting around the block. He tends to pee on it because of where it sits on his underside and the shortness of his torso, but it’s easy to wash in the sink and dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: can get along and do her business great!!
customer_reviews.text: My partially paralyzed 17 pound pug, Rosie, can get along and do her business great!!! We bought a small. She was rescued with spinal cord damage that keeps her from bearing weight on her hind legs. It keeps her using as many muscles as possible and she can keep up with the rest of the pug pack :-)
customer_reviews.author: Anne Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is The best lead on the market and I did a lot of research before purchasing. The only change I would make is add a pocket to the outside that Velcro’s closed for doggie bags etc.,.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: How Did We Live Without This?!! Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: We have an 11 year old, 175 pound Newfoundland with arthritis in her back legs. She has so much trouble standing up to get moving. This harness has seriously enriched our lives, making it actually possible to help our big girl get up!
customer_reviews.author: Appalonia

customer_reviews.title: Positioning the sling for male dogs
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for our 130 pound Pyrenees after rear ACL surgery. Careful adjustment should be tended for your pet to actually "wear" the device. Overall very helpful for our big dog.
customer_reviews.author: Artie

customer_reviews.title: Great for post op
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my dog to use after her acl surgery. She has bad hips and already had one bad leg, so we knew she would have a hard time with recovery. This has been such a help keeping her sturdy and keeping her weight off the leg she just had surgery on. It also makes it easy to lift her - she is a little over 70 pounds and I have no trouble lifting her with this. Great purchase for dogs who are having knee or leg surgeries, or just older dogs with bad hips or knees.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Herring

customer_reviews.title: it was like operating the strings of a marionette
customer_reviews.text: The cost was ridiculous for the amount of nylon it took to make this contraption. It put undo pressure on my small dogs abdomen, very awkward, it was like operating the strings of a marionette. Next time I will search for a quality, handmade specialized product, I found one for my large dog, you may pay through the nose but if it works it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: A Very Happy Boxer and Her Mom
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this product. I have a 70 pound Boxer whose hind legs are not strong enough to make it up a flight of stairs. We have two flights of stairs to climb in my home! This product is perfect. I purchased the medium female size, and I'm safely able to guide her up the stairs. She is once again happy and confident, and so am I!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Carr

customer_reviews.title: Helps my 🐕. Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for to help my 24 lb 🐕 on his walks and up hills (he has bad knees and hips). Is well made and comfortable as well as washable. It's adjustable and has cushy handle if you choose to use it.
customer_reviews.author: zoo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my dog with hip issues. The only difficulty I have found with the product is when my dog stands on an incline he sometimes slips around in the ginger lead. He has not slipped out completely, but almost. Otherwise it works so well that he has gotten a bit " cocky" and feels he can lead me around. Much better than me having to hold his back end up on his walks as we had been doing before ginger lead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: GingerLead Dog Support & Rehabilitation Harnesses - Padded Sling with Leash for Comfort and Control
feature_bullets: FEATURES – No Bunching - Padded for Comfort - Integrated Leash - Cutout for Male Dogs - Adjustable for Height - Easy to Use - Soft Corduroy Lining - Includes Stay on Straps - Chest Harness not Included
MACHINE WASHABLE AND DRYABLE – The superior quality and durability of the GingerLead is preserved after machine washing and drying. Proudly MADE IN U.S.A.

USED IN VETERINARY HOSPITALS - GingerLeads are used by veterinarians throughout the United States. Recommended for recovery from TPLO / cruciate, hip or back surgery, physical therapy, to assist senior dogs suffering from arthritis, degenerative myelopathy or vestibular disease, and disabled pets needing help with mobility or balance.

SIZING - Support pad is 5.5" wide (at the cutout) x 22.5" long. Sling length adjusts from 38" - 60" long. Please measure to ensure the proper fit. The cutout in the support pad accommodates most medium to giant breed male dogs as well as female dogs.

OUR INSPIRATION – The experiences helping our 6 month old Golden Retriever puppy, Ginger, recover from reconstructive hip surgery for severe hip dysplasia, then knee surgery a few years later, was the inspiration for our patented design. The GingerLead harness was a lifesaver again when Ginger was old and needed help up and down stairs, and out for walks.
